alert.note: Alert for Rota (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 02 at 4:50PM ChST until December 06 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST MONDAY... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 11 feet along north facing reefs. Surf could approach 12 feet along east facing reefs later in the weekend. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents along north and east facing reefs. * WHERE...Guam and Rota Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM ChST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
